The National Voter Registration Act requ: 2. H.R. 1 would expand the role government offices play in registering voters, requiring applicants to "opt out" instead of "opt in" for voter registration.
H: R. 1 does not single out people seeking public assistance but would broadly require government agencies to help eligible individuals register to vote.
The claim that H: R. 1 automatically registers every welfare recipient to vote is misleading, as the bill aims to expand voter registration efforts for eligible individuals across various government agencies.
